turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kingdom of Italy.
turn.1: What was the relationship between the Italians and the Bolsheviks?
turn.2: Many pacifist and internationalist Italian socialists turned to Bolshevism and advocated negotiations with the workers of Germany and Austria–Hungary to help end the war and bring about Bolshevik revolutions.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: "Avanti!", the newspaper of the Italian Socialist Party, declared: "Let the bourgeoisie fight its own war". Leftist women in Northern Italian cities led protests demanding action against the high cost of living and demanding an end to the war.
turn.6: In Milan in May 1917, communist revolutionaries organized and engaged in rioting, calling for an end to the war and managed to close down factories and stop public transportation.
turn.8: The Italian Army was forced to enter Milan with tanks and machine guns to face communists and anarchists who fought violently until 23 May, when the Army gained control of the city with almost 50 people killed (three of which were Italian soldiers) and over 800 people arrested.
turn.10: After the disastrous Battle of Caporetto in 1917, Italian forces were forced far back into Italian territory as far as the Piave river.
turn.12: The humiliation led to the appointment of Vittorio Emanuele Orlando as Prime Minister, who managed to solve some of Italy's wartime problems.
